body:
Comment 4: 
// Readdirnames reads and returns a slice of names from the directory f.
// If n > 0, Readdirnames returns at most n names.
// In this case, if Readdirnames returns an empty slice, it will return
// a non-nil error explaining why.  At the end of a directory, the
error is os.EOF.
// If n <= 0, Readdirnames returns all the names from
// the directory in a single slice.  In this case, if Readdirnames succeeds
// (reads all the way to the end of the directory),
// it returns the slice and a nil os.Error.  If it encounters an error
// before the end of the directory, Readdirnames returns the names
// read until that point and a non-nil error.
func (f *File) Readdirnames(n int) (names []string, err os.Error)
